intro: Ligusticum duriusculum, commonly known as the rough ligusticum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine environments. Ligusticum duriusculum is valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
